definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
when the enemies come face to face, their eyes blaze with hatred (idiom)
pinyin: chou2 ren2 xiang1 jian4 , fen4 wai4 yan3 hong2

sentences.english: Of course, many developing countries are envious of China's rise.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有很多发展中国家对天朝之崛起可谓分外眼红。

sentences.english: Tom always flaunts his electronic productions. I really want to make him feel jealous once.
sentences.chinese: 总是炫耀他那些电子产品，我也想让他嫉妒眼红一回。

sentences.english: He looked disgustingly healthy when he got back from the Bahamas.
sentences.chinese: 他从巴哈马群岛回来时看上去健康得令人眼红。

sentences.english: The fact that there'll be a lot of money made by somebody doesn't bother me really.
sentences.chinese: 有很多人会赚到很多钱，但我真的不眼红。

sentences.english: The share price China southern railway fell again, Buffett would be green with envy.
sentences.chinese: 中国南车股价再跌，巴菲特真要眼红了。

sentences.english: Denis himself doesn't work hard, however, he is always green-eyed of other people's achievements.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯自己不努力，还老是眼红别人的成就。

sentences.english: Chen Long see Yuan Hao, especially, people hang him up.
sentences.chinese: 陈龙看到袁浩，分外眼红，让人把他吊了起来。

sentences.english: He is green-eyed with his success.
sentences.chinese: 她对他的成功感到眼红。

sentences.english: She is green-eyed with his success.
sentences.chinese: 她对他的成功感到眼红。

sentences.english: Prince saw an enemy particularly jealous, spot called hand during the siege.
sentences.chinese: 太子一见仇人分外眼红，当场招呼手下围攻李世民。

sentences.english: BE during the days in the high school of sworn enemies, the personal enemy meet, cent outside jealous.
sentences.chinese: 原来是中学时的死对头，仇人相见，分外眼红。

definition: to water at the mouth/to drool
to covet/to long for/to lust after
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to drool (over) (idiom)/to yearn for/to covet/to crave
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
(coll.) to be eager for/to long for/to look forward to
to admire/to hold in high esteem
